title: Heart of Darkness
author: Joseph Conrad
description: A novella about Charles Marlow's journey up the Congo River and his encounter with Kurtz.

title: The Scarlet Letter
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
description: A story set in 17th-century Puritan Massachusetts about a woman who is shunned for bearing an illegitimate child.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A futuristic novel that anticipates developments in reproductive technology, psychology, and conditioning.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: A novel set in a future where books are outlawed and 'firemen' burn any that are found.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A psychological novel that explores the mind of a man who has committed murder.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: An ancient Greek epic poem that tells the story of Odysseus's adventures as he returns home from the Trojan War.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A sweeping novel set during the Napoleonic Wars, focusing on five Russian aristocratic families.

title: Lord of the Flies
author: William Golding
description: A novel about a group of boys stranded on a deserted island who attempt to govern themselves.

title: Catch-22
author: Joseph Heller
description: A satirical novel set during WWII, dealing with the absurdity of war and bureaucracy.

title: The Sun Also Rises
author: Ernest Hemingway
description: A story of expatriates living in Paris in the 1920s, and their journey to Spain.

title: To the Lighthouse
author: Virginia Woolf
description: A novel that examines the complexities of family relationships and the passage of time.

title: A Farewell to Arms
author: Ernest Hemingway
description: A novel set during WWI, focusing on the love story between a soldier and a nurse.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
description: An epic tale of the Buendía family over several generations in the town of Macondo.

title: The Bell Jar
author: Sylvia Plath
description: A novel about a young woman's mental breakdown and journey towards recovery.

title: Slaughterhouse-Five
author: Kurt Vonnegut
description: A satirical novel about a soldier's experiences in WWII and his encounters with time travel.

title: Invisible Man
author: Ralph Ellison
description: A novel exploring African-American identity and racism in the early 20th century.

title: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
description: A novel about the haunting legacy of slavery as experienced by a family.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
description: A harrowing journey of a father and son through a desolate, post-apocalyptic landscape.

title: The Old Man and the Sea
author: Ernest Hemingway
description: A novel about an aging fisherman’s struggle to catch a giant marlin.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A novel about the corrupting influence of beauty and the supernatural.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A novel set in the roaring twenties, exploring themes of wealth, class, and the American Dream.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A novel about Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy as they navigate love, family, and societal expectations.

title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
author: Mark Twain
description: A novel about Huck Finn and Jim, a runaway slave, as they journey down the Mississippi River.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
description: A novel about the Joad family's struggles during the Great Depression.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: A novel about the obsessive hunt for a white whale by the protagonist, Captain Ahab.

title: The Sound and the Fury
author: William Faulkner
description: A novel about the decline of a Southern aristocratic family through multiple narrative perspectives.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A novel about Holden Caulfield's struggles with adolescence and disillusionment.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A high fantasy novel about the quest to destroy the One Ring and save Middle-earth.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about racial injustice, tolerance, and the loss of innocence in a small Alabama town.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
description: A comedic science fiction novel about the misadventures of an unwitting human and his alien friend.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
description: A novel about a totalitarian future society where women have lost all their rights.

title: The Color Purple
author: Alice Walker
description: A novel about the struggles of African-American women in the early 20th century.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
description: A novel about the complex relationships between two Afghan friends and the power of redemption.

title: The Brief Wondrous Life of Oscar Wao
author: Junot Díaz
description: A novel about identity, culture, and family history, set in both the Dominican Republic and the United States.

title: The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks
author: Rebecca Skloot
description: A non-fiction book about the life of Henrietta Lacks, whose cancer cells were taken without her knowledge and led to numerous scientific breakthroughs.

title: The Devil in the White City
author: Erik Larson
description: A historical book about the 1893 World's Columbian Exposition in Chicago and the serial killer H.H. Holmes.

title: The Sixth Extinction
author: Elizabeth Kolbert
description: A non-fiction book about the current mass extinction event caused by human activity.

title: The Emperor of All Maladies
author: Siddhartha Mukherjee
description: A non-fiction book about the history of cancer and its treatment.

title: The Lost City of Z
author: David Grann
description: A non-fiction book about the British explorer Percy Fawcett and his expeditions to the Amazon.

title: The Ghost Map
author: Steven Johnson
description: A non-fiction book about the 1854 cholera outbreak in London and the discovery of the source of the disease.

title: The Invention of Nature
author: Andrea Wulf
description: A non-fiction book about the life and work of Alexander von Humboldt, a German explorer and naturalist.

title: The Radium Girls
author: Kate Moore
description: A non-fiction book about the women who worked with radium in factories during World War I and their struggles with radiation poisoning.

title: The Power
author: Naomi Alderman
description: A speculative fiction novel that explores a world where women suddenly develop the ability to release electrical jolts from their fingertips.

title: The Song of Achilles
author: Madeline Miller
description: A novel that reimagines the Trojan War from the perspective of Achilles' lover, Patroclus.

title: The Nightingale
author: Kristin Hannah
description: A novel about two sisters in France during World War II.

title: The Hate U Give
author: Angie Thomas
description: A novel about a young black girl who witnesses the fatal shooting of her unarmed friend by a police officer.

title: The Poppy War
author: R.F. Kuang
description: A fantasy novel set in a world inspired by Chinese history and mythology.

title: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo
author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
description: A novel about the life of a reclusive Hollywood star and her seven marriages.

title: The 7 1/2 Deaths of Evelyn Hardcastle
author: Stuart Turton
description: A murder mystery novel that follows the story of Aiden Bishop, a man who wakes up each day in a different body.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
description: A psychological thriller about a famous painter who is accused of murdering her husband and refuses to speak.

title: The Last Romantics
author: Tara Conklin
description: A novel about four siblings who grow up together and the power of family bonds.

title: The Family Upstairs
author: Lisa Jewell
description: A psychological thriller about a young woman who inherits a mansion and uncovers dark secrets about the family who lived there.

title: The Au Pair
author: Emma Rous
description: A mystery novel about a young woman who returns to her family's estate and uncovers secrets about her family's past.

title: The Last House Guest
author: Megan Miranda
description: A psychological thriller about a woman who becomes embroiled in a mystery involving a murder at a summer rental property.

title: The Stranger Diaries
author: Elly Griffiths
description: A modern take on the Sherlock Holmes story, featuring a writer of horror stories who becomes embroiled in a real-life murder mystery.

title: The Invited
author: Jennifer McMahon
description: A horror novel about a couple who build a modern eco-friendly home in the woods, but soon discover that it may be haunted.

title: The Other Mrs. Miller
author: Allison Dickson
description: A psychological thriller about a woman who discovers that her husband is leading a double life.

title: The Last Time I Lied
author: Riley Sager
description: A psychological thriller about a woman who returns to the summer camp where her friends disappeared 15 years earlier.

title: The Witch Elm
author: Tana French
description: A mystery novel about a young man who returns to his family's ancestral home after a traumatic event and becomes embroiled in a mystery involving a skull found in the garden.

title: The 17th Suspect
author: James Patterson
description: A thriller novel about a detective who must solve a series of murders in San Francisco.

title: The President is Missing
author: Bill Clinton and James Patterson
description: A thriller novel about a president who goes missing and the detective who must find him.

title: The Word is Murder
author: Anthony Horowitz
description: A mystery novel about a detective who is hired to investigate the murder of a wealthy woman.

title: The 8th Circle
author: Sara Davison
description: A thriller novel about a detective who must solve a series of murders in a small town.

title: The Last Equation of Isaac Severy
author: Nova Jacobs
description: A mystery novel about a young woman who inherits a mysterious equation from her grandfather and must uncover its secrets.

title: The Other People
author: C.J. Tudor
description: A horror novel about a man who discovers that his daughter has been taken by a mysterious figure.

title: The Family Plot
author: Cherie Priest
description: A horror novel about a family who inherits a haunted house from a distant relative.

title: The Rust Maidens
author: Gwendolyn Kiste
description: A horror novel about a group of teenage girls who are transformed into strange and terrifying creatures.

title: The Hunger
author: Alma Katsu
description: A reimagining of the Donner Party's ill-fated journey across the American West.

title: The Changeling
author: Victor LaValle
description: A fantasy novel about a man who discovers that his wife has been replaced by a mysterious figure.
